p: You are right about the washing - and I am glad you do not want it. I'll be so glad though it I can be of help to you and to the Wubs. I understand that Hilda has a great deal of extra work for Honbausak Sons, and that she hires Maxine at times when possible. So may be I could go in and take the Wubs out in the Park on certain days so that Maxie can type for Hilda - I don't Know much about things but I feel sure I shall be able to help all 'round and helping makes me happy. So it is quite selfish on my part.

Daddy is really looking forward to you and to the basement with the freedom of going outdoors when he pleases and being out of the way. I am so glad because that means that I can be with you children sooner than I ex

pected. It would be wonderful to spend February and part of March with you providing things work out as pleasantly for you as I know they will for us. We have been very fortunate to be able to sell first editions out of our Library - and we hope to be able to make several hundred dollars that way.
I think I'll put our washing machine over at Mrs Cantwells' while we're gone, letting her use it in return for looking after our plants and Mr George Cat.
Loads of Love goes with this is very little news to you both
